metadata.title: CVE-2019-6454 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in sd-bus in systemd 239. bus_process_object() inlibsystemd/sd-bus/bus-objects.c allocates a variable-length stack bufferfor temporarily storing the object path of incoming D-Bus messages. Anunprivileged local user can exploit this by sending a specially craftedmessage to PID1, causing the stack pointer to jump over the stack guardpages into an unmapped memory region and trigger a denial of service(systemd PID1 crash and kernel panic).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-6454` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-myhostname - 229-4ubuntu21.16
libnss-mymachines - 229-4ubuntu21.16
libnss-resolve - 229-4ubuntu21.16
libpam-systemd - 229-4ubuntu21.16
libsystemd0 - 229-4ubuntu21.16
libudev1 - 229-4ubuntu21.16
systemd - 229-4ubuntu21.16
systemd-container - 229-4ubuntu21.16
systemd-coredump - 229-4ubuntu21.16
systemd-journal-remote - 229-4ubuntu21.16
systemd-sysv - 229-4ubuntu21.16
udev - 229-4ubuntu21.16
No subscription required

criterions.comment: systemd package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '229-4ubuntu21.16').
